Reviews.Title: “They cheated me and it was too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room with en-suite as it is sais when you are going to book the room by easytobook, then I arrived there and the guy who was there told me that I hadn't, that my room had no bathroom and if I wanted a bathroom I had to pay 30 pounds more, so I told him I wanted to cancellate the room and he told me it wasn't possible, so in the end, he took me to another hotel next to this, to the Euro hotel and made me pay 30 more to have a bathroom. The room was in the basement so I could hear every step they made, and also they offered wifi but it wasn't in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!”
Reviews.Author: helen r
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting, i wish i had read the reviews before we booked! It is filthyand shouldn't be allowed to operate. I think everyone else has said what i wanted to say apart from the breakfast. We arrived for breakfast at 8pm to find scrabbled and fried eggs in a dish on the side board along with a dish of beans and a plate of toast all of which were cold. The same food still sat there on the side at 8.45 stone cold. Teh dining room was also the office.Avoid at all costs!!!

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Katya H
Reviews.Content: a normal place to stay for a few days.you should'x expect better conditions for that money :)

Reviews.Title: “infested with bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: laksdjfl
Reviews.Content: This hotel (it is not a hotel it is a cheap hostel/b&b at the most) is infested with bed bugs. We first stayed at a 4 bedroom, and one of the beds was full of them with my friend being covered in itchy bites. After he moved out, my boyfriend and I moved to another room and now we are both covered in bites..100, maybe more. It is now 4am because I can't sleep and do not want to lie in a bed like that. Tomorrow I am going to the Holiday Inn. Do not go here...pay more to have a decent place where it is not rediculously noisy and warm and you have your own bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware Of Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: It is not the best place to stay...but if you want some cheap room... better have some bedbug spray...aaaand there is a roof leak...so on a rainy days you can have a shower directly in to your bed..for freee ^_^

Reviews.Title: “Shocking! Disgusting! Rank...!”
Reviews.Author: Jake D
Reviews.Content: Words cannot quite explain this. In my 18 years of living, I have NEVER, EVER seen such a disgusting place! The two of us booked a twin room for Â£60 for 1 night. We got placed in a family room with 3 beds and there was a shower cubicle actually in the room! It started to rain and the water was dripping into the room through the cracks. Im not one to comaplin but it just had to be done. So we then got moved to a double room. As I put the key in the door I could smell something really awful! I opened the door and just gagged and nearly threw up. I have never smelt something so unbelievable! I'm now writing this the day after and im sitting at home still feeling ill. I dare not try the breakfast, so, sorry I cant comment on that. Words of advice - avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSING APPAULING”
Reviews.Author: BelfastBeth
Reviews.Content: This so called hotel is disgusing dont stay it it ever. The website says ensuite there was no ensuite the owner claimed there wasn't any ensuites in the hotel. The shower was a make shift shower in the room, the toilet outside in corridor. There was a fridge in the room which was a health hazard, table and chair? wardrobe with a suspect blanklet lurking in the bottom of it with the back of the wardrobe hanging off. It was the absolute pits. I went into the kitchen downstairs it was undescribable there was fridges with just inner working on them no outside covering very suspect. I only stayed in this hotel as I had previously stayed in a hotel on the same road which was very good and I thought it was the same one big mistake. They charged Â£90 per nite for this a complete rig off.

Reviews.Title: “This place should NOT be called a hotel”
Reviews.Author: loveantoinette
Reviews.Content: I really am not a picky person nor am I a complainer so I didn't really mind the lack of God-knows-how-many things in this hotel. It's actually I believe 3 guesthouses (Plaza, Rex, and I forgot the other one) all pretty much right next to each other on the same block. I checked in before 2pm, and I was actually more than grateful after waiting 15 mins to know that my room was ready at 11:30am. I was jetlagged, exhausted, and deprived of sleep, so when the person took me to my room, it looked like heaven initially. I slept for an hour or two, woke up, and after getting some rest, got to see how there is absolutely nothing special about the place. I had a single room, basic with sink and shower stall installed in the room. Just barely there space for my luggage and other stuff. Only TWO electric plugs in the whole room, so I just unplugged the lil 15-inch old-school TV and used it for my stuff. As I looked around, it looked really dirty actually; the wool comforters were stained/dirty, the bedsheets had holes in it, and the carpeted floor looks dusty/dirty although I've seen first hand that they do vacuum the floors haha. The ceiling paint was peeling off yet the colors arent faded. Lets just say I've seen cleaner and better hostels than this so-called "hotel". I stayed there for about a week, and did "meet" a mouse who passed from one hole to another in my room. I wasn't the least bit scared being I've been in worst conditions but I was rather surprised. If you're not into mickey mouse paying you a visit, don't come. If you dont mind, it wont bother you the least bit. I literally only used this place for sleeping and showering and changing; oh plus the free breakfast! Beats having to pay up to 5pounds for breakfast elsewhere. English breakfast (without the sausage and bacon) with some cereal, wheat cakes, tea/coffee, orange juice. If you dont care for luxuries, this is enough. If you are going to be hanging out a lot in your room, dont bother being here. Oh and one more thing, while I was there last week, the WiFi only worked in the main Plaza Hotel building; my room was in the Rex Hotel next door where they were doing construction so WiFi was down =o( Had to go hang out at the dining area/living room/reception area when I needed the internet. The best thing about this place was that it was close to some major buses [which stopped almost in front of the place] and underground stations, and walking distance to some BIIIGGG mall that I never went to [although I kept seeing it on the tube passing by.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply the worst Hotel room I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: Chimmiecham
Reviews.Content: Originally booked at the Acropolis and was called to say that it was over booked and agreed to move to their sister hotel. The booking was for the Primal Scream gig at Olympia (fantastic!) and the room was booked for 4 guys to share - all single beds and with EN-SUITE facilities. On arrival we were given keys to the room and front door of the Plaza Hotel next door to the Rex (sign on the door of the Plaza sends you to the Rex to check in.) The room for 2 nights (4 sharing) was Â£200.00 so not over the top on a four way split, but if this was a family room - 2 adults + kids Â£100.00 per night would have been daylight robbery for a room that was well below any standard for any hotel. On check in, we were asked to pay by cash as the card machine was out of action - as it turns out the reception man/owner? said that the previous ownership of the hotel(s) had gone into administration hence the card machine wasn't available to pay. They also offered to settle by Paypal - which I opted for on MY OWN LAPTOP - fortunate that I had a paypal account and laptop with me. Under no circumstances should anyone use a hotels computer to do a payment - key logging or recording of your details is a possibilty. THE ROOM - have a look at the pictures - they're worth a thousand words!!!! Remember we had booked for four single beds with en-suite - what we got was a room with a double and two singles one of which had a shower cubicle beside it - no roof so any steam would have gotten into the room Thats if any of the four blokes actually wanted to shower in a cubicle with no privacy. (We're shy at heart :) The toilet and shower were shared with the other two rooms on the same floor and anybody that wanted to use it as they passed by! The decor would have made Rigsby's Rising Damp B&B look like the Hilton - old worn, very rough. Communal shower was antiquated, produced lukewarm water and get there first before the other two bedrooms as you will have no access to a toilet until they're finished! Breakfast (which is complimentary) consisted of fried or scrambled eggs, toast, beans, cereal and coffee/tea. But again get down early, the five table room also serves for at least another two hotels in the same block - queues were outside the room the whole time as it only served for 1.5 hours (7.30-9.00) ok if it was serving just it's own residents, but insufficient . I could go on for another two pages, but the hotel isn't worth it, unless you're into down grading below any reasonable standard that you can think of.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: SophieRidsdale
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a college trip and it was a very bad experience. The rooms are always cold as the radiators never turned on even though the radiators in the corridor worked. The furniture is mismatched and there is not an en-suite there is a communal toilet in the corridor and a tiny little cupboard for a shower in in your room. The location was okay but it was obviously in a rough area as there was police cars going up and down the street every 5 minutes and as you are on the main road you can hear them all the time. The rooms were a very low standard and not somewhere you would want to sleep. There was mattresses and chairs blocking the fire exit on the basement floor where I stayed. The service was not very good as the staff never spoke to you and I did not go down for breakfast but at 5am every morning I was awoken by the kitchen staff making breakfast even though they only offered you cereal and eggs. For the 2 nights i stayed i did not get any sleep as the rooms were so cold I had to wear a scarf and jumper for bed. The value for money is not very good and i would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and misleading”
Reviews.Author: traveler_uk_10
Reviews.Content: Not a nice hotel: fridge was full of rotting old food when we arrived; asked for an en suite and got charged for one, even though toilet was down the hall; furniture was like cardboard and falling apart. Not worth the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the net site!”
Reviews.Author: SmilinGroa
Reviews.Content: We got a very warm welcom, in an extremly varm "reseption". As it turned out, when we discovered the standards of the rooms, we checked out - and payed for one night. The hotel had a standard far FAR beneath a norwegian standard. And we are not talking about a high class standard. A showercabinet beside the bed, on a flossy carpet. Yak!

Reviews.Title: “This is cheap but I still have a feeling i overpaid”
Reviews.Author: NarekM
Reviews.Content: Actually they messed up my order and put me in one of other building they manage, had me move twice, I was freezing at night. Rooms had no shower and toilet. The shower serving all other guests was tiny. It was generally clean, stuff moderately friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible accomodation and Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: Claire_wLeeds
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for two nights whilst at a conference and I can safely say it is terrible. The man on reception refused to help me carry my 3 heavy bags up to my room which I was told was ensure and turned out not to be! In the morning I went down for breakfast which I was told was between 7 - 9am, I went at 7.45, 8, 8.15, 8.30 and 8.45 and there were no seats. I infomed the ladies who were in the kitchen, only to be shrugged at and looked at blankly. When I complaionned about this when I checked out I was told that I should of informed hotel staff which I did. The room was dirty and the deco terrible. I would not return ever.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty horrible - avoid unless it's the cheapest you can find”
Reviews.Author: katiescarlett78
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in about 20 of London's cheapest hotels, and this is the second-worst (the worst being the Northumberland in Kings Cross). The decor hasn't been touched since about 1981, and all the nooks and crannies are full of dirt. There was a long black hair on the tabletop in my room. The room did have a freestanding shower cabinet, but so old and grimy I could hardly bear to look at it, let alone use it. It also had a TV, which is unusual for a cheap hotel, but the reception was appalling. Bizarrely, the room was packed with unnecessary furniture - a wardrobe, a chest of drawers, a bedside table and even an ancient fridge - but the few things that really would have made a difference (a lampshade on the bare bulb, a bedside light) were missing! Having said that, the bed was comfy and I slept very well. The breakfast room was surprisingly light and pleasant, but breakfast was unimpressive: Tesco cornflakes, concentrated orange juice, and scrambled/fried eggs with white toast. I know budget hotels can't exactly offer a full English; but they could at least have stretched to a choice of cereals. I definitely wouldn't stay here again unless I could get it for much less than the Â£35 I paid.

Reviews.Title: “cozy and hospitibal”
Reviews.Author: canadianbackpacker9
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Plaza/Rex hotel for one night but in that one night, the Oscar, the owner, and his son treated me very well. The breakfast in the morning was also excellent...beans, eggs, and fresh coffe...can't go wrong with that! If you like the personal touch and people you can trust, this is the place. Oscar has been running this business for 25 years and I can see why he is still in business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and great value”
Reviews.Author: fozzyj87
Reviews.Content: This is my first review and I would recommend this place to anyone who was after a basic room for a few nights which represented good value. Breakfast was included as well which was quite nice with a selection of cereal and hot breakfast. Perhaps the best aspect of this hotel was the staff. Was able to leave our bags with them pre check in and checkout on two occastions for the day which made thing much easier considering the amount of luggage we had. Furthermore, other requests and assistance were also met with a smile. The place is owned by a family and they are very friendly. Its location isn't too bad being in zone 2 for the underground and being about a 10 minute walk from s.bush station or hammersmith. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Ãœberraschung! Positively Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: sassenach0204
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking for an "acceptable" accomodation for my 7 day stay, which can be in London - letÂ´s face it - quite a challenge. I was looking for sth affordable but clean ! and nice, not too far from the hot spots. I payed abt 48 GBP per night inlc.breakfast. That was what I got: The room looked exact the way it did in the pics. Although it was in the basement, it had a window, a TV (4 major programms), a fridge, a chair and of course a bed. All was in working order and - for british standards - very clean. If you are german like me, donÂ´t look in the corners or put on your glasses. ThatÂ´s just London. Bathroom - en suite - small but fine. New interiors, nothing rotten or foul. Water was hot at any time of the day as long as you showered and powerful running (IÂ´ve experienced different in London ;-) ). It was cleaned daily, no hairs left in the bath! Since IÂ´ve a bad back, the mattrace was a challenge. It was more or less new, but not a high standart 7* one. I put the blanket and daybed underneath the linen and could sleep like an angel. Which you normally should do anyway after a whole day out in town. SheperdÂ´s Bush is the perfect start with the tube in any direction. Station is abt 5 min walk away, busses to Hammersmith, Barnes, Richmond, etc. 2 min. (I even walked to Hamm.and Barnes - abt 20 min). Local shops, bars and restaurants (also fastfood) are around in a short walk, but far enough away not to desturb the quiet in the night. Well, quietness in an old house is one thing. The other is other travellers who throw the door ;-) But at night all was nice and slepping. Breakfast contained of eggs, toast, beans, jam, cornflakes. Orange juice,tea and coffee, too. I was always stuffed after it. If my hubby would have ordered some more. Small room, st you had to wait for a few min if you came in the "rush hour" at 8:15. Just get up a little earlier and have a room almost by yourself. Anyway you can have linen serviettes or cleenex. Here it is cleenex. You can have a suite or a small room just for the rest and a film in the evening. Here it is the latter. You choose what you like. If you choose the Plaza or Rex (same) you get a great budged acc with friendly and helpful staff. From business people to families all were there and liked it. Uncomplicated, clean and simple. I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, convenient, reasonable - what else do you need???”
Reviews.Author: Parisis4Me
Reviews.Content: Being the first to write a review on this hotel, I want to make sure to capture all the aspects for a future traveler. We stayed here 9 days - making reservations for 4 days and then extending it another 5 after being pleased with the first 4. They are performing updates on the hotel, which makes it nice. The hotel is in a residential part of town that appears to be renovating houses into B&B's. Rooms are average European size - #9 was nice size for 3 people. The owners are EXTREMELY friendly and accommodating. Bathrooms are very much on the small size, but everything is kept clean. Breakfast consists of juice, milk, coffee, tea, cereal, eggs, beans and toast. Convenient bus lines (72, 220, 283, 295) stop right in front of the hotel that will take you to the train or tube if you don't want to walk the 4 blocks (8 min). The train takes you to Gatwick with only one change. Shepherd's Bush Station is on the Central Line, which is a convenient tube line to just about everything. The rooms have a small refrigerator for keeping some drinks/food, and they have a microwave for your use if you want to heat anything. Neighborhhood grocery store is only 2 blocks away (TESCO) to stock your frig. No hairdryers though, so bring your own if you need one. WIFI worked great, and if you make any reservations while there, the office will print the documents for you. Overall, for the price, this was a suprisingly nice little secret. Around the Shepherd's Green park area (2 blocks), there are also great pubs for very reasonable lunch/dinners. Always felt safe no matter what time of the day or night.

HotelInfo.Name: Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 53 Shepherds Bush Road, London W6 7LU, England
